com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g3d.physics

Class OcclusionCuller

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g3d.physics.OcclusionCuller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

    public abstract class OcclusionCuller
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    Performs the occlusion culling or k-DOP culling using the dynamic bounding volume tree from the Bullet broad phase.

    Occlusion culling is a process that determines which objects are visible or hidden from the viewpoint of a camera. This is achieved by rendering the bounding boxes of collision objects to a depth buffer using a software rasterizer. When determining if an object is visible to the camera, this depth buffer is queried and compared against the depth of the object in question.

    k-DOP culling determines which objects are inside a camera frustum. The process is accelerated by the dynamic bounding volume tree.

    Author:
    jsjolund

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable

      • isOccluder

        public abstract boolean isOccluder(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btCollisionObject object)
        True if this collision object can block vision of other collision objects. If true, its collision shape will be drawn to the depth buffer and considered in future occlusion checks. Only btBoxShape collision shapes can be occluders, other types of shapes will be ignored. However, box occluders can block vision of any type of collision shape.
        Parameters:
        object - Object to check.
        Returns:
        True if the collision object can occlude other objects.

      • onObjectVisible

        public abstract void onObjectVisible(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btCollisionObject object)
        When performing occlusion culling, this method is a callback for when a collision object is found to be visible from the point of view of the camera.

        When performing k-DOP culling, this method is a callback for when a collision object is found to be inside the camera frustum (regardless of occlusion).

        Parameters:
        object - A collision object which is visible to the camera.

      • performKDOPCulling

        public void performKDOPCulling(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtBroadphase broadphase,
                               com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera)
        Performs k-DOP (k-Discrete Oriented Polytope) culling using the Bullet method btDbvt.collideKDOP(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtNode, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.linearmath.btVector3, java.nio.FloatBuffer, int, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.ICollide). Finds all collision objects inside the camera frustum, each of which will trigger a callback to onObjectVisible(btCollisionObject). The process of finding objects in frustum is accelerated by the broad phase dynamic bounding volume tree (btDbvt).
        Parameters:
        broadphase - The dynamics world broad phase.
        camera - Camera for which to perform k-DOP culling.

      • performOcclusionCulling

        public void performOcclusionCulling(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtBroadphase broadphase,
                                    OcclusionBuffer oclBuffer,
                                    com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera)
        Performs occlusion culling using the Bullet method btDbvt.collideOCL(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtNode, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.linearmath.btVector3, java.nio.FloatBuffer, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3, int, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.ICollide, boolean). Finds all collision objects which are visible to the camera, where vision is not blocked (occluded) by another object. If a collision object from the broad phase is visible to the camera, a callback is made to onObjectVisible(btCollisionObject). Only collision objects for which isOccluder(btCollisionObject) returns true can occlude others. These collision objects must have a btBoxShape collision shape. However, box occluders can block vision of any type of shape.
        Parameters:
        broadphase - The dynamics world broad phase.
        oclBuffer - The occlusion buffer in which to query and draw depth during culling.
        camera - Camera for which to perform occlusion culling.

      • performOcclusionCulling

        public void performOcclusionCulling(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtBroadphase broadphase,
                                    com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera)
        Performs occlusion culling using the Bullet method btDbvt.collideOCL(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtNode, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.linearmath.btVector3, java.nio.FloatBuffer, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3, int, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.ICollide, boolean). Finds all collision objects which are visible to the camera, where vision is not blocked (occluded) by another object. If a collision object from the broad phase is visible to the camera, a callback is made to onObjectVisible(btCollisionObject). Only collision objects for which isOccluder(btCollisionObject) returns true can occlude others. These collision objects must have a btBoxShape collision shape. However, box occluders can block vision of any type of shape.
        Parameters:
        broadphase - The dynamics world broad phase.
        camera - Camera for which to perform occlusion culling.

      • performOcclusionCulling

        public void performOcclusionCulling(PhysicsWorld3D physicsWorld,
                                    com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera)
        Performs occlusion culling using the Bullet method btDbvt.collideOCL(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtNode, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.linearmath.btVector3, java.nio.FloatBuffer, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3, int, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.ICollide, boolean). Finds all collision objects which are visible to the camera, where vision is not blocked (occluded) by another object. If a collision object from the broad phase is visible to the camera, a callback is made to onObjectVisible(btCollisionObject). Only collision objects for which isOccluder(btCollisionObject) returns true can occlude others. These collision objects must have a btBoxShape collision shape. However, box occluders can block vision of any type of shape.
        Parameters:
        physicsWorld - The physics world to reference broad phase from.
        camera - Camera for which to perform occlusion culling.

      • performOcclusionCulling

        public void performOcclusionCulling()
        Performs occlusion culling using the Bullet method btDbvt.collideOCL(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.btDbvtNode, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.linearmath.btVector3, java.nio.FloatBuffer, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3, int, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision.ICollide, boolean). If a collision object from the broad phase is visible to the camera, a callback is made to onObjectVisible(btCollisionObject). Only collision objects for which isOccluder(btCollisionObject) returns true can occlude others. These collision objects must have a btBoxShape collision shape. However, box occluders can block vision of any type of shape.
